title: Best beachfront hotels in Los Angeles
excerpt: Finding the perfect beachfront hotel in Los Angeles can be a daunting task, as the city boasts a plethora of options that vary in style and amenities. This curated list highlights the best hotels that not only offer stunning ocean views but also provide an unforgettable experience, making your getaway truly special. Discovering these hidden gems can elevate your vacation from ordinary to extraordinary.
intro: Explore the ultimate guide to the best beachfront hotels in Los Angeles, where sun, sand, and luxury await.

hotels.name: Casa Del Mar
hotels.description: Experience a luxurious oceanfront getaway at Casa Del Mar, where you can savor fresh seafood at Catch and enjoy stunning views alongside live music at The Terrazza. Each elegantly designed room features a hydrotherapy spa tub, floor-to-ceiling windows, and modern amenities, ensuring ultimate relaxation. With pet-friendly options and a prime location near the vibrant 3rd Street Promenade, your memorable stay awaits.
hotels.highlight: Boasts oceanfront rooms with hydrotherapy spa tubs, floor-to-ceiling windows, and on-site dining with fresh seafood options.

hotels.name: Shutters On The Beach
hotels.description: Experience beachfront luxury at Shutters On The Beach in Santa Monica, where you can enjoy gourmet meals at two oceanfront restaurants, from sophisticated dining to casual fare. Relax by the outdoor pool or indulge in a spa treatment while taking in stunning ocean views. Each elegantly appointed room features modern amenities, plush bathrobes, and some even offer private balconies or spa bathtubs for an added touch of comfort.
hotels.highlight: Offers beachfront luxury with gourmet dining, an outdoor pool, and elegantly appointed rooms with ocean views and private balconies.

hotels.name: The Ritz-Carlton, Marina del Rey
hotels.description: Experience unparalleled luxury at this stunning waterfront property, where breathtaking marina views await you from the outdoor pool and sun-lounger terrace. Savor delicious Californian cuisine at the on-site restaurant while enjoying panoramic ocean vistas. With elegantly furnished rooms featuring private balconies and a state-of-the-art fitness center, plus easy access to Venice Beach and local attractions, this hotel is the perfect retreat for relaxation and exploration.
hotels.highlight: Offers breathtaking marina views, elegantly furnished rooms with private balconies, and an outdoor heated saltwater pool.

hotels.name: Venice Breeze Suites
hotels.description: Experience the ultimate beachfront escape at Venice Breeze Suites, where modern studios feature full kitchens and free WiFi, all just steps from the lively Ocean Front Walk. The standout rooftop deck invites you to relax with barbecue facilities and ocean views, while select suites add charm with exposed brick walls and cozy seating areas. Enjoy convenient amenities and nearby attractions like Santa Monica Pier, making this the perfect spot for your next getaway.
hotels.highlight: Boasts modern studios with full kitchens, a rooftop deck with ocean views, and beach umbrellas for guest convenience.

hotels.name: Hotel Erwin Venice Beach
hotels.description: Experience the ultimate beachside luxury at Hotel Erwin, where every room boasts stunning ocean views, 49-inch flat-screen HDTVs, and cozy seating areas. Relax at the open-air rooftop lounge, offering breathtaking panoramic sights of Venice Beach and the Pacific Ocean, perfect for sipping drinks in the California sun. With its prime location just steps from the Venice Beach Boardwalk, guests can easily explore local attractions, bike paths, and rollerblading spots.
hotels.highlight: Offers stunning ocean views, a rooftop lounge, and easy access to Venice Beach Boardwalk attractions.

hotels.name: Viceroy Santa Monica
hotels.description: Experience the luxurious Viceroy Santa Monica, located just 25 km from Los Angeles and boasting breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean. Indulge in relaxation with two outdoor pools and private cabanas, and take advantage of the hotelâ€™s prime location to explore nearby attractions like Santa Monica Place, 3rd Street Promenade, and The Getty Museum. Make your stay unforgettable at this oceanfront retreat.
hotels.highlight: Offers breathtaking Pacific Ocean views, two outdoor pools, and private cabanas in a prime beachfront location.

faqs.question: What are the average prices for beachfront hotels in Los Angeles during peak season?
faqs.answer: During peak season, which typically runs from June to August, beachfront hotels in Los Angeles can range from $300 to $600 per night for standard ocean-view rooms. It's advisable to book well in advance, as prices tend to increase closer to your travel dates and availability becomes limited.

faqs.question: Which beachfront hotels in Los Angeles offer family-friendly amenities?
faqs.answer: Family-friendly beachfront hotels such as the Loews Santa Monica Beach Hotel and the Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach Resort & Spa provide amenities like kids' clubs, swimming pools, and easy beach access. These properties often host family-oriented activities, making them ideal for travelers with children.

faqs.question: Are there any beachfront hotels in Los Angeles that allow pets?
faqs.answer: Yes, several beachfront hotels in Los Angeles, including the Hotel Casa del Mar and Shutters on the Beach, welcome pets. Be sure to check each hotel's specific pet policy, as there may be size restrictions and additional fees involved.

faqs.question: What is the best area to stay in Los Angeles for easy access to the beach?
faqs.answer: Santa Monica and Venice Beach are the top areas for easy beach access, with a variety of beachfront hotels such as the Santa Monica Proper Hotel and the Venice Beach House. These neighborhoods not only offer stunning ocean views but also provide numerous dining and entertainment options within walking distance.

faqs.question: How can I find deals on beachfront hotels in Los Angeles?
faqs.answer: To find the best deals on beachfront hotels in Los Angeles, consider booking during the off-peak seasons, such as late fall or winter. Additionally, using hotel comparison websites and signing up for newsletters from your preferred hotel chains can provide exclusive discounts and promotional offers.
